alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 7:38PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Grafton County through 830 PM EDT... At 738 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Groton, or 13 miles northwest of Plymouth, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Plymouth, Grafton, Hanover, Haverhill, Enfield, Canaan, Danbury, Groton, Piermont, Woodstock, Bristol, Lyme, Alexandria, Bridgewater, Hebron, Benton, Dorchester, Ellsworth and Orange. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 49 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
